ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Aggregate_connectivity_requirement is the association between a set of one or more and one that ensures that the requirement for connectivity is maintained between the functional and the physical designs.
the design_definition_path specifies the role of the for the Aggregate_connectivity_requirement.
the connectivity_requirement specifies the role of the for the Aggregate_connectivity_requirement.
If the type of the design_definition_path is a , then the attribute of the connectivity_requirement shall be equal to the design_definition_path.

If the type of the design_definition_path is a , then the attribute of the connectivity_requirement shall be equal to the referenced through the path consisting of design_definition_path, it's attribute and it's attribute .

ext_description.p: Each of the terminals that participate in a connectivity_requirement shall be reachable from any other terminal in the design_definition_path that is specified by the same connectivity_requirement.
ext_description.note: This is a closure requirement on the set of terminals. Since the hierarchical product structure is represented in this part of ISO 10303 as a directed acyclic graph, the closure state is evaluated by traversing the combined graph including both product structure and nodal representation at each node of the graph.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An application shall not allocate this to both a and to a for the same revision of the physical product.
The combination of design_definition_path and connectivity_requirement shall be unique within a population of Aggregate_connectivity_requirements.

ext_description.p: A Connectivity_allocation is the relationship between a functional connectivity requirement and its implementation. The collection of functional terminals in the functional decomposition that are connected is allocated to one equivalent physical node. That equivalent physical node is an implementation in the Connectivity_allocation.
ext_description.note: This part of ISO 10303 supports the capability to specify the paths through the functional decomposition that are reachable via terminals associated with given nodes. This is a statement of transitive closure for connectivity across the decomposition. This part of ISO 10303 does not separately represent a fully resolved functional node.

ext_description.p: the connectivity_requirement specifies the role of the for the Connectivity_allocation.
ext_description.note: The connectivity_requirement effectively specifies one equivalent functional node.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the implementation specifies the role of the for the Connectivity_allocation.
The implementation shall be unique within a population of Connectivity_allocations.
